text: <https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/recruiting-tech-volunteers-fight-covid-19-ethiopia|https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/recruiting-tech-volunteers-fight-covid-19-ethiopia>

attachments.title: Recruiting Tech Volunteers to Fight COVID-19 in Ethiopia
attachments.text: A Washington-based software developer is recruiting other techies to combat the spread of the new coronavirus in his native Ethiopia, following the lead of countries such as China and South Korea with early experience in what is now a global pandemic. “We need an army of tech volunteers to help the Ethiopian Ministry of Health collect, analyze and report to the agency so that we can assist them in the time of need,” Mike Endale wrote in his online solicitation.  “The better data collection/analysis/reporting there is, the better the response and the more effective the mitigation strategies
attachments.fallback: Voice of America: Recruiting Tech Volunteers to Fight COVID-19 in Ethiopia

elements.text: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/recruiting-tech-volunteers-fight-covid-19-ethiopia

text: Hi guys i just want to say that dont you think that the MoH has to prepare some 2-5 containers as an ICU in every wereda/Kebele's health centers for stand by situation and when the need comes they can be deployed in the wereda/kebele's health centers.

elements.text: Hi guys i just want to say that dont you think that the MoH has to prepare some 2-5 containers as an ICU in every wereda/Kebele's health centers for stand by situation and when the need comes they can be deployed in the wereda/kebele's health centers.

text: That’s a good idea but it’s not the space that is a problem. It’s the equipment. According to wikipedia   “Common equipment in an ICU includes <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanical_ventilator|mechanical ventilators> to assist breathing through an <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tracheal_intubation|endotracheal tube> or a <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tracheostomy_tube|tracheostomy tube>; cardiac monitors for monitoring Cardiac condition; equipment for the constant <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_monitors|monitoring> of bodily functions; a web of <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intravenous_fluids|intravenous lines>, feeding tubes, <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasogastric_intubation|nasogastric tubes>, suction pumps, drains, and <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catheters|catheters>, syringe pumps; and a wide array of <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharmacology|drugs> to treat the primary condition(s) of hospitalization. <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Induced_coma|Medically induced comas>, <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Analgesic|analgesics>, and <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedation|induced sedation> are common ICU tools needed and used to reduce <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pain|pain> and prevent” These things are what’s in shortage.

text: This also goes along with misinformation or lack of accurate information. I have been hearing a lot of people say a) its too warm for viral spread b) COVID doesn't harm black/brown people or that it is a foreigner's disease c) its only a few people and they are getting better. So I think documents with the correct information and maybe even a list of do and do not heard towards the culture might be helpful.

text: I was trying to ask if this can work for coronavirus: <https://phys.org/news/2019-08-smartphone-based-device-norovirus-cruise-ship.html>

attachments.title: Smartphone-based device for detecting norovirus, the 'cruise ship' microbe
attachments.text: Made infamous by outbreaks on cruise ships, norovirus can really ruin a vacation, causing severe vomiting, diarrhea and stomach pain. But the highly infectious virus can also strike closer to home, with water- and foodborne outbreaks occurring in municipal water systems, schools and restaurants. Today, researchers report a sensitive, portable device that can detect as few as a handful of norovirus particles in water.
attachments.fallback: Smartphone-based device for detecting norovirus, the 'cruise ship' microbe

text:
<@UV8B0679P> :point_up_2:consistent to the broadcast and following through the efforts from the Association of Ethiopian Architects, I am looking for someone to engage with here. I am working from abroad but my colleagues are in Addis too. We can develop working plans quickly on our side but we need engagement from the MoH and other institutions. any recommendations?
<https://twitter.com/antenehtesfayeT/status/1242069755021930497>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/antenehtesfayeT|@antenehtesfayeT>: The industrial parks built in different cities in Ethiopia can offer viable alternatives for spaces of isolation and treatment. Save time and cost, and are distant from congested urban areas.
Similar to these spaces:point_down:<https://www.architecturaldigest.com/story/should-us-follow-china-model-makeshift-hospital-stop-coronavirus> <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETy3IodWkAILIdh.jpg>

text: the PMO is working on an API and a similar dashboard. The api will be openly available. If you want to integrate it I think that will be the best option

text: We are happy to have your data be available through our api. We have already built it and have the infrastructure to support a massive number of requests. That way all the data on your dashboard will be available to other developers over a programming interface.
